result.execSummary:
The defendant Mareano D Carrillo was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Disorderly Conduct [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse Assessments], a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).
  • Telephone Harassment [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse Assessments], a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.012(1)(b).
  • Telephone Harassment [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse Assessments], a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.012(1)(a).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

*4 days credit if revoked* 
**Probation can end after 9 months if PO deems it appropriate**

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Mareano D Carrillo

records.addlTxt: Time to Pay Summary - Return to Sender, Not Deliverable as Addressed, Unable to Forward

9:53 AM case called. Defendant Mareano D Carrillo in court.  Attorney Roger M Hillestad in court for Mareano D Carrillo.  Prosecuting attorney Tiffany M. Winter in court for the State of Wisconsin. 
There is an agreement which the Defense recites. State in compliance with victim notification requirements. Defendant is advised of charges, maximum penalties, elements of the crime(s) and constitutional rights. 
Defendant pleads No Contest to counts 2, 3 and 4 as charged in the criminal complaint. 
Court accepts pleas, finds the defendant Guilty and withholds sentencing. Anything else is dismissed and read in. 
Defendant makes a statement before sentencing. 
Defendant is placed on Probation for 12 months with conditions: 
Probation can end after 9 months if the Probation agent finds it appropriate. 
Any conditions, programming or treatment per the agent and follow through with recommendations. Provide a DNA sample. 
No contact with D.C. without their approval and the approval of the probation agent. 
Defendant to pay court costs including applicable surcharges. 
Count 2 only: 10 days in Jail with Huber all stayed pending further order of the Court.

10:37 AM Prosecuting attorney Trenton John Piltz in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Mareano D Carrillo in court.  Attorney Roger M Hillestad in court for Mareano D Carrillo. 

Settlement Conference (by phone) with District Attorney's Office (715-839-4828) on 07/27/22 at 3:30pm
Hearing scheduled for August 24, 2022 at 09:30 am.
